page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT CRESSBROOK
page.content: This is a mainly farming area,and the farms are worked by the owners and their immediate families.The stone- cutting at Cressbrook Mill is also family run.A part-time cleaner and part-time dinner lady are employed at the school.Some women in the village cater for visitors to the area providing bed and breakfast.The rest of the work force work outside the area. There is virtually no unemployment in the area. The outside work force is engaged in quarrying, lorry driving and fluorspar mining. Five men work in Sheffield; 2 university lecturers 1 car dealer 1 senior gas board official 1 in hospital management. There is a local club which employs a resident steward and wife. There is a shop and a post-office.
